en.name: cowsay
en.description: Runs 'cowsay' in the host. Is protected from your 'sudo rm -r's

examples.description: Generates an ASCII image of a cow with a message
Disables word wrap, allowing the cow to speak FIGlet or to display other embedded ASCII art. Width in columns becomes that of the longest line, ignoring any value of `-W`.
Specifies width of the speech balloon in columns, i.e. characters in a monospace font. Default value is 40.
“Borg mode”, uses == in place of oo for the cow′s eyes.
“Dead”, uses XX, plus a descending U to represent an extruded tongue, also used on Linux kernel oops.
“Greedy”, uses $$.
“Paranoid”, uses @@.
“Stoned”, uses ** to represent bloodshot eyes, plus a descending U to represent an extruded tongue.
“Tired”, uses --.
“Wired”, uses OO.
“Youthful”, uses .. to represent smaller eyes.
Manually specifies the cow′s eye-type, e.g. `cowsay -e ^^`
Manually specifies the cow′s tongue shape, e.g. `cowsay -T \(\)` for a pair of parentheses.
Specifies a .cow file from which to load alternative ASCII art. Accepts both absolute file-paths and those relative to the environment variable `COWPATH`.
Lists the names of available cow-files in the `COWPATH` directory instead of displaying a quote.

pi.name: Cow!
pi.description: Force a cow to fight in the brig

examples.description: Write a message on the map
Ye switch to disable word wrapping
Set yer width
Yer `oo` eyes
Yer `XX` eyes
Yer `$$` eyes
Yer `@@` eyes
Yer `**` eyes
Yer `--` eyes
Yer `OO` eyes
Yer `..` eyes
Put yer own eyepatch on yer cow
Put yer own tongue on yer cow
Select a specific cow from the market
Get all cows that you can steal
